Topic: Geography
Question: What is the capital of the state where Johns Hopkins University is located?
Choices:
  A: Baltimore
  B: Annapolis
  C: Des Moines
  D: Las Vegas

Thought: 
Johns Hopkins University is located in Baltimore, Maryland.
The capital of Maryland is Annapolis.

Topic: Law
Context: A panel of five scientists will be formed. The panelists will be selected from among three botanists—F, G, and H—three chemists—K, L, and M—and three zoologists—P, Q, and R. Selection is governed by the following conditions: The panel must include at least one scientist of each of the three types. If more than one botanist is selected, then at most one zoologist is selected. F and K cannot both be selected. K and M cannot both be selected. If M is selected, both P and R must be selected.
Question: Which one of the following is an acceptable selection of scientists for the panel?
Choices:
  A: F, G, K, P, Q
  B: G, H, K, L, M
  C: G, H, K, L, R
  D: H, K, M, P, R
  E: H, L, M, P, Q
Reflection:
You previously answered this question incorrectly.
Then you reflected on the problem, your solution, and the correct answer.
Use your self-reflection (below) to help you answer this question.
Any information that you are not allowed to see will be marked [REDACTED].
No reflection information provided.

Thought:
We need at least one scientist from each category (botanist, chemist, zoologist).
Options A and E are immediately out because they have two zoologists and only one botanist, violating the rule "If more than one botanist is selected, then at most one zoologist is selected."
Option B includes both K and M, violating the rule "K and M cannot both be selected."
Option C includes K but not M, so it doesn't violate any rules so far. It has one from each category (G-botanist, K-chemist, R-zoologist), so it fulfills the requirements.
Option D includes M, so it requires both P and R to be selected, which it does. It also has one from each category (H-botanist, M-chemist, P and R - zoologists), fulfilling the requirements.
Therefore, both options C and D are valid. 
Action: Answer("C")
